snippet: Russia’s leaders took part in a trade union parade with an estimated crowd of 150,000, as a nation re-enacted celebrations from the Soviet era.
abstract: About 150,000 Russians gather in Moscow for a May Day trade union parade, re-enacting celebrations from the Soviet era; country's leaders, including Pres Dmitri A Medvedev and Prime Min Vladimir V Putin, are present at the event for the first time since 1996.

byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer and Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Russia’s leaders took part in a trade union parade with an estimated crowd of 150,000, as a nation re-enacted celebrations from the Soviet era.

headline.seo: Putin and Medvedev Join Moscow’s May Day Parade
headline.main: An Extra-Official Touch for Russia’s May Day
headline.print_headline: An Extra-Official Touch for Russia’s May Day
